bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Enrique Saladrigas, January 2, 1953

div1.p: Hench thanks Saladrigas for his hospitality when Hench was in Cuba for the Camp Lazear dedication. He requests a copy of Saladrigas' speech given at the ceremony. He suggests more could be done at the memorial site, including a public health center.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Enrique Saladrigas, January 2, 1953
div1.opener:
January 2, 1953
Dr. Enrique Saladriguas
Ministro de Salubridad y Asistencia Social
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Saladrigas:
div1.p:
Now recovering from the Christmas festivities into which I plunged on my
return from Cuba, permit me to express to you and to your compatriots my
sincere thanks for your kind hospitality during my recent visit to Cuba on
the occasion of the dedication of Campamento Lazear. Many Americans are
very happy that your government saw fit to join in honor the American Yellow
Fever Commission and its volunteers with the name of your illustrious
scientist, Carlos Finlay.

Doctor Saladriguas, I have been asked to make a formal presentation before
the staff of the Mayo Clinic telling about the ceremony. I would appreciate
it greatly if you would send me a copy of the speech which you gave at the dedi-
cation of Camp Lazear. I hope it will not be too inconvenient for you to send
me a copy and if it can be sent air mail, that would help me greatly in the
preparation of my presentation to the staff.

I think an excellent beginning has been made at Camp Lazear but I hope that a
more extensive memorial can be developed in the future through the coopera-
tion of Americans as well as your countrymen. Would it not be fine if there
could be developed on that spot a living memorial to Doctors Finlay, Delgado,
Reed and associates? Perhaps it might be a public health unit for Marianao
intimately connected, with one room built around the present caseta, the rest
of the building to be a useful living memorial to serve the people of that
district. I will be most happy to collaborate with you and your associates
to continue the development of any further memorial on that spot.

It was a pleasure for me to dine with President and Senora Batista, yourself
and Senora Saladrigas at the palace. The week in Cuba was a delightful
affair.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
P.S.: Permit me to send you herewith a reprint which describes the re-
discovery of Camp Lazear, see page 3.
